data.event: George Washington first visited the Springfield area in 1748 as a member of a party that surveyed the land holdings of Thomas Fairfax, 6th Lord Fairfax of Cameron in the South Branch Potomac River valley.
The Town of Springfield was formally established on December 16, 1790.
In June 1861, the town organized a company of men known as the "Potomac Guards" in support of the Confederacy.
